intro: Coelorachis striata var. laevis, commonly known as the smooth-striated orchid, is a species of orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and linear, lanceolate leaves that are smooth and glabrous. The plant produces pendulous inflorescences bearing small, pale green to white flowers with a distinct striated pattern on the petals. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural collections.
